Human Resource Manager (Upstream Oil & Gas Experinece) Job at Ralds & Agate




        
    

        
        Ralds & Agate (R&A) is an Organizational Effectiveness Firm focused on providing People and Process related solutions to businesses, communities and organizations within and outside Africa. We bring to the table a versatile & cumulative business and professional experience of over 4 decades. Multifaceted industry experience across Oil & Gas, Research & Technology, Hospitality, Manufacturing, Financial services etc.We work to support C suite clients to ensure that they derive value from their very valuable asset: their Employees. We are focused and committed towards building partnerships and mutually beneficial long term relationships with our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Human Resource Manager (Upstream Oil & Gas Experinece)

Job Location: Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Lead and execute HR operations, including talent acquisition, performance management, employee relations, policy implementation, and compliance.
	Manageend-to-end recruitment processes, developing sourcing strategies, and leading onboarding for new hires.
	Serve as a trusted advisor to staff and management, resolving workplace conflicts and promoting a positive workplace culture.
	Coordinating the performance management process and supporting managers in setting goals and development plans for their teams.
	Overseeing HR administrative functions such as leave, attendance, benefits, and payroll support.
	Ensuring full compliance with labor laws and internal policies, and coordinating statutory filings.


Requirements


	A minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Human Resource Management, Industrial Relations, or a related field, with a professional certification (CIPM, SHRM, HRCI, etc.) being required. A master's degree or MBA is an added advantage.
	A minimum of 10 years of overall HR experience, with at least 5 years in a generalist HR role.
	A deep understanding of Nigerian labor laws, HR regulatory frameworks, HRIS, and reporting systems.
	Possessing skills in communication, leadership, recruitment, employee relations, and analytical and report writing.
	Demonstrating attributes such as professionalism, integrity, proactiveness, and strategic thinking.
	Experience in the upstream oil & gas sector or similar industries is highly desirable and non-negotiable.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@raldsandagate.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Realty
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an experienced real estate professional with diverse skills, a positive attitude, and a strong commitment to excellence.
	The ideal candidate will lead our realty division, drive strategic growth, build lasting client relationships, and develop partnerships that expand our market presence and increase revenue.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee the management of the company's real estate portfolio, including acquisitions, dispositions, and lease agreements.
	Initiate/originate and execute real estate business not limited to facility management, property development (residential, commercial, malls, site and service), purchase and sales, agency, brokerage, facilitation, advisory services etc.

	Regularly promote, publish and advertise properties and products/services using effective regular media platforms, sponsorships, events and social media channels for defined target market/audience.
	Conduct regular property evaluations to assess market conditions and identify opportunities for optimization.
	Analyze potential real estate investments, conducting feasibility studies and financial analysis.

title: Office Assistant Job at Zurishaddai Recruitment Agency
content:
Zurishaddai Recruitment Agency was established in 2021 to provide professional Human Resources consulting and services to organizations of all sizes. We provide services, resources, and expertise in support of your Company's unique Human Resource needs. We are Human Resource professionals with over 5years of experience in this field.

Our Agency can act on your behalf as your Human Resources representative, or we can provide support and expertise to complement existing HR staff. We take the time to develop a strong working relationship with you by understanding your needs, your business and your corporate culture. With that understanding, we recommend solutions in line with your business needs and then work with you to implement them.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Office Assistant

|Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Office Assistant to provide administrative support and maintain the overall organization and cleanliness of our office for immediate employment .
	This role involves a mix of administrative tasks, communication, and office maintenance.


Responsibilities
Clean and organize the office, including:


	Dusting and polishing furniture and fixtures
	mopping floors
	Cleaning bathrooms and kitchen areas
	Restocking supplies and paper products
	Maintain office supplies and inventory


Greet clients and visitors:


	Provide general information and support to staff and clients.


Requirements


	Education:OND / SSCE
	Experience: 2+ years of Previous administrative experience preferred


Skills:


	Excellent communication and organizational skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	Proficient in Microsoft Office and other relevant software
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to lift light cleaning supplies and equipment
	Hard working and intelligent young person
	Must reside within Lekki Phase 1.

	 Salary: N50,000.00 - N65,000.00
	Opportunities for growth and development
	Collaborative and dynamic work environment.
